title: Great Wyrley artists’ paintings in the frame
text:
Three-day Staffordshire scarecrow festival 
She said: “It’s purely recreational, there’s no instruction. People just come along and paint, and so many turn out to be quite talented. 
“There are so many different styles of art within the group that if anyone needs any guidance, there’s always someone to turn to that can help. 
“We hardly ever get a vacancy, not unless one of us dies or leaves the area, although we had a couple of new members this year.” 
Mrs Haimes, who is taking along 14 of her pictures, joined the club 12 years ago after retiring from teaching IT at schools in Willenhall, West Bromwich and Walsall. 
She said each member contributed one painting to a permanent exhibition at the community centre where the club regularly meets. When a picture is sold, it is replaced by another by the same artist. What do you think? Be the first to comment 
But tomorrow, more than 100 paintings will be on show. Artists’ equipment will also be on sale along with homemade cake and coffee. 
“We paint in a partitioned-off area of the hall, which is small so it restricts our numbers, but it’s lovely and light, with windows all down one side,” said Mrs Haimes. 
“For our annual exhibition, the hall is opened up and lined with our paintings. It’s a very social occasion which people from the village look forward to.” 
The club also organises outings for members, including visiting galleries and other art-themed visits. 
Admission to the exhibition, which is open between 10am - 4pm, is free. Receive daily email updates from the Express & Star
